videoSnippet.title: No Spoliers, Game Too Good! || Artemiev vs Vidit || FIDE Chess.com Nations Cup (2020)
videoSnippet.description:
Watch Juga's Video here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i9F8LS_-eGU&feature=youtu.be

Watch me jump around on a horsey https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iSO-v3oRV-A

Follow me on Instagram for extra content and notifications https://www.instagram.com/agadmator/

Vladislav Artemiev vs Santosh Gujrathi Vidit
FIDE Chess.com Online Nations Cup (2020), 9.5.2020
Torre attack (Tartakower variation) (D03)

1. d4 Nf6 2. Nf3 d5 3. Bg5 Ne4 4. Bh4 Qd6 5. Nbd2 Qh6 6. Qc1 g5 7. Nxe4 dxe4 8. Bxg5 Qh5 9. Ng1 Bg7 10. c3 c5 11. Bd2 Nc6 12. e3 Bg4 13. Ne2 O-O-O 14. b4 cxb4 15. cxb4 Kb8 16. b5 Qxb5 17. Rb1 Qd5 18. Nc3 Qe6 19. Na4 Ka8 20. Rxb7 Qd6 21. Nc5 Nxd4 22. Rxa7+ Kxa7 23. Qa3+ Kb6 24. Qb4+ Kc6 25. Qb7+ Kxc5 26. Bb4#

The FIDE Chess.com Online Nations Cup is a 6-team double round-robin tournament taking place from 5-10 May 2020. Teams consist of 6 players, with 4 playing in each round. At least one woman must play in each match.

Players receive 25 minutes for the entire game, plus a 10-second increment starting from move one. No draw offers are allowed before move 30. The top 2 after the round-robin will play a Superfinal. Official website: chess.com

judgment.name: Blunder
judgment.comment: Checkmate is now unavoidable. Bc8 was best.
